TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IHelpService

Docs.summary: Provides methods for showing Help topics and adding and removing Help keywords at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The design-time environment provides a Help system that attempts to locate relevant Help topics to display when a user presses F1. The Help system maintains a set of current context keywords that are used to identify relevant topics if Help is requested. By default, keywords are associated with selected class objects and properties of objects in the design time environment. The default keyword for a component or property is its fully qualified class or property name. Specific keywords are also associated with certain modes, such as when multiple objects are selected. If a custom Help collection is integrated with the design-time environment by configuring it for an external help provider, a documentation provider can associate a topic for a specific component class or property with a keyword consisting of the item's fully qualified type or member name.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService> can be used to invoke the help service with a specified keyword using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService.ShowHelpFromKeyword%2A> method, or to invoke a help topic from a specified URL using the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService.ShowHelpFromUrl%2A> method.
The <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService> can also be used to add or remove Help keywords at design time. Selecting a component or property at design time sets a default context keyword consisting of the fully qualified type or member name of the selection, and removes the keywords for any previously selected and no longer selected components or properties.
Because the Help system does not automatically remove custom Help keywords, you must explicitly remove a custom keyword when it no longer applies. You can monitor the events defined by the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ISelectionService> interface to determine when a component selection changes. Based on those events, you can add a Help context attribute for a component when it is selected and then remove the Help context attribute when the selection no longer includes the component.
## Examples The following example demonstrates a designer that uses the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService> to add and remove Help context attributes for the included control. To use this sample, compile it to a class library and add an instance of the control to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form>. In design view, selecting the component and pressing F1 attempts to look up relevant Help topics based on the current Help context keyword or keywords. Right-click the component and the shortcut menu displays commands, including two custom <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerVerb> commands named `Add IHelpService Help Keyword` and `Remove IHelpService Help Keyword`. These commands can be used to add or remove a Help context keyword of the value "IHelpService", which attempts to raise the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.IHelpService> topic when F1 is pressed.
[!code-cpp[IHelpServiceExample#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IHelpServiceExample/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[IHelpServiceExample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IHelpServiceExample/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[IHelpServiceExample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/IHelpServiceExample/VB/source.vb#1)]

The type of the keyword, from the enumeration .
Docs.summary: Adds a context attribute to the document.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Context attributes are used to provide context-sensitive Help to users. The designer host automatically adds context attributes from available Help attributes on certain components and properties. This method allows you to further customize the context-sensitive Help.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ClearContextAttributes() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all existing context attributes from the document.
